result.execSummary:
The defendant MARIE DANIELLE DANIELSON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
PAYABLE TO CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE - 30 days to pay or request a payment plan. 
Bond applied. Balance due October 3, 2022.
All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

Plus supervision fees. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Absolute sobriety.
No intoxicants.
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs. 
Not to possess or consume any alcohol. 
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 
Not to possess or consume any prescription drugs not prescribed. 
Not to possess syringes unless medically required.
No association with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs. 
No contact with S.L.P. without her consent and agent's written consent.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.
